description: From Latin deficiens, present participle of deficere (“to lack, fail, be wanting”); see defect.

adjectives.description: deficient (comparative more deficient, superlative most deficient)

entries.meaning: Lacking something essential; often construed with in.
examples: They were deficient in social skills.

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Of a number n, Having the sum of divisors σ(n)<2n, or, equivalently, the sum of proper divisors (or aliquot sum) s(n)<n.

examples: This was justified by the rationale that mental deficients, by definition, are not able to succeed in society.
